SEARCH
Package Implementation

Class DataManager

java.lang.Object
Implementation.DataManager
public class DataManager extends Object
A base class for managing data operations on CSV files. This class provides basic functionality for reading and writing CSV data, as well as accessing and modifying specific data points within the CSV structure.

  • Field Summary

  • Field Details

    • filePath

      protected String filePath

  • Constructor Details

    • DataManager

      public DataManager(String filePath)
      Constructs a DataManager with the given file path.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the CSV file to manage

  • Method Details

    • readCSV

      public List<String[]> readCSV()
      Reads the CSV file and returns its contents as a list of string arrays. Each array represents a row in the CSV file, with each element representing a column.
      Returns:
      A list of string arrays representing CSV rows
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error reading the file

    • writeCSV

      public void writeCSV(List<String[]> data)
      Writes the given data to the CSV file. Each array in the list represents a row, with each element representing a column.
      Parameters:
      data - A list of string arrays representing CSV rows
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error writing to the file

    • getData

      public String getData(int row, int index)
      Retrieves data from a specific row and column index in the CSV file.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index (0-based)
      index - The column index (0-based)
      Returns:
      The data at the specified position, or null if the position is invalid

    • setData

      public void setData(int row, int index, String data)
      Sets data at a specific row and column index in the CSV file.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index (0-based)
      index - The column index (0-based)
      data - The new data to set at the specified position

    • removeData

      public void removeData(int index)
      Removes a row from the CSV file.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the row to remove (0-based)
